description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Requesting_EntityObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Requesting_EntityObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Requesting_EntityObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Accounting_WorktagObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

For types that require a parent reference, the unique identifier type of a parent object.

Requesting_Entity_Data.description: Reference to existing worktags. Worktags are a way to mark tasks and business objects to make them easier to access and summarize.  Each transaction can include one value for each worktag type and is subject to configurable validation when submitted for approval.

validation.validation: [worktag value] is not permitted as an allowed value for worktag type: [worktag type], because it is inactive.
Par or Inventory requisition types aren't supported for requesting entity.
Only one worktag for each type is allowed for a Requesting Entity.
[list of worktag types] worktag not valid for the requesting entity.
Enter a Deliver-To location that doesn't have a Ship-To usage.
You can't assign an inactive requisition type as the default requisition type for the requesting entity.
